channel.title: Drowning508 [Official and Only Release Thread]
channel.description:
[B][COLOR=Red]THIS IS A 508 NOT A 508/525 OR z508![/COLOR][/B] --- [B][COLOR=Red]Another thing, this release is a release of the Beta version of Drowning508, which means there is MANY bugs/glitches that need to be fixed by YOU, there is no anti leech if you compile there should be no errors but I warn you this contains many bugs and is not suitable to be hosted as an actual server as soon as the download is complete, a lot of work was put into this but it needs more from you.[/COLOR][/B] [B] It has many features I do not want to list them all so just look @ the pictures.[/B] [b]NOTE: YOU WILL NEED TO FIX THE PRICE LOADING FOR THE GE TO GET THE PRICES TO SHOW, DO IT YOURSELF DON'T ASK ME![/b]
--- How to fix the GE prices: In geloader.java Search for [code]FileReader fr[/code] Replace that whole line with [code]FileReader fr = new FileReader("data/items/grandExchange.cfg");[/code] ---
Pictures: [img]http://i42.tinypic.com/246mbeh.png[/img] [img]http://i40.tinypic.com/2ih155z.png[/img] [img]http://i44.tinypic.com/2cffqqt.png[/img] [img]http://i44.tinypic.com/1zxsduo.png[/img] Goodbye everyone, goodbye all my friends, goodbye for good...

item.title: Drowning508 [Official and Only Release Thread]
item.dc:creator: @Kr3m1in Kr3m1in
item.description:
@Kr3m1in wrote:

[quote=“TinyScape, post:315, topic:350058”]I’m assuming you’re running in an IDE…

[code=java]
public static void main(String[] args) {
String a1 = “43594”;
try {
socketListener = new SocketListener(Integer.parseInt(a1));
} catch (Exception e) {

        e.printStackTrace();
        return;
    }
    mapData = new MapData();
    mapData.loadRegions();
    loadBannedUsers();
    engine = new Engine();
            GrandExchangeLoader = new GrandExchangeLoader();
            GrandExchangeLoader.loadOffers();
    playerSave = new PlayerSave();
    socketListener.run();
}[/code]Replace what you've just posted with that. I don't know much about this stuff, so don't expect that to work.[/quote]

Yea, it didn’t. It made things worse.

Read full topic

item.title: Drowning508 [Official and Only Release Thread]
item.dc:creator: @tinyscape TinyScape
item.description:
@tinyscape wrote:

I’m assuming you’re running in an IDE…

[code=java]
public static void main(String[] args) {
String a1 = “43594”;
try {
socketListener = new SocketListener(Integer.parseInt(a1));
} catch (Exception e) {

        e.printStackTrace();
        return;
    }
    mapData = new MapData();
    mapData.loadRegions();
    loadBannedUsers();
    engine = new Engine();
            GrandExchangeLoader = new GrandExchangeLoader();
            GrandExchangeLoader.loadOffers();
    playerSave = new PlayerSave();
    socketListener.run();
}[/code]Replace what you've just posted with that. I don't know much about this stuff, so don't expect that to work.

Read full topic

item.title: Drowning508 [Official and Only Release Thread]
item.dc:creator: @Kr3m1in Kr3m1in
item.description:
@Kr3m1in wrote:

Error:

java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException: 0 at palidino76.rs2.Server.main(Server.java:75) Press any key to continue . . .

Here’s the code:

public static void main(String[] args) { try { (THIS IS LINE 75) socketListener = new SocketListener(Integer.parseInt(args[0])); } catch (Exception e) { /* * If this happens then the specified port is most likely already in use. */ e.printStackTrace(); return; } mapData = new MapData(); mapData.loadRegions(); loadBannedUsers(); engine = new Engine(); GrandExchangeLoader = new GrandExchangeLoader(); GrandExchangeLoader.loadOffers(); playerSave = new PlayerSave(); socketListener.run(); }

I have no clue what the issue is here.

Read full topic
